main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects were observed in Blytheville, Arkansas on 29 March 1967.
interesting points: Measurements indicated that sightings occurred 40 to 50 degrees above the horizon., The observer reported seeing three different sightings with varying colors; first sighting long white light, second sighting blue to white to pink, third sighting yellow., The first sighting moved rapidly to the west and disappeared., The total duration of the observations was approximately 20 to 25 minutes for the first two sightings and 5 minutes for the last., The witness was described as a reliable housewife who spoke with sincerity and intelligence.
witness description: Mrs. B., a housewife from Blytheville, Arkansas, described the sightings sincerely and intelligibly.
